intro: Calandriniopsis montana, commonly known as the mountain calandriniopsis, is a flowering plant native to high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the grass family (Poaceae) and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, spike-like inflorescences. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, and it produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are adapted for wind pollination. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
